sourcesContent:
export const questionObj = {"Qtext": "

Consider the figure given below. Suppose through the mid point N of side KL of a 
parallelogram IJKL , the line JN is drawn intersecting IK at O and IL 
produced in M . Prove that \(MO = 2JO \).


\newline
tikzpicture{}
\newline

", "Steps": [{"id": "s1", "n_params": 3, "step_txt": "In triangles JNK and MNL , we have 
\[
	NK = NL 
\]
\[
	\angle \input[s1v1]{}\input[s1v2]{}\input[s1v3]{} = \angle LMN 
\]
\[
	\angle JNK = \angle MNL 
\]"}, {"id": "s2", "n_params": 0, "step_txt": "
So, by angle side angle rule, we can say that these two triangles are congruent.
\[
	\Rightarrow \Delta JNK \cong \Delta MNL 
\]"}, {"id": "s3", "n_params": 2, "step_txt": "
So, we can write
\[
	\Rightarrow \input[s3v1]{}\input[s3v2]{} = LM 
\]"}, {"id": "s4", "n_params": 3, "step_txt": "$$\text{
Also, we have $\input[s4v1]{} \input[s4v2]{} = JK $}$$
\[
	\Rightarrow IM = IL + LM = JK + JK 
\]
\[
	\Rightarrow IM = \input[s4v3]{} JK 
\]"}, {"id": "s5", "n_params": 3, "step_txt": "
Now, in triangles IMO and KJO , we have 
\[
	\angle \input[s5v1]{} \input[s5v2]{} \input[s5v3]{} = \angle KJO 
\]
\[
	\angle IOM = \angle KOJ 
\]"}, {"id": "s6", "n_params": 0, "step_txt": "
So, we can write 
\[
	\Delta IMO \sim \Delta KJO 
\]"}, {"id": "s7", "n_params": 3, "step_txt": "
So, now we can write
\[
	\frac{MO }{JO } = \frac{IM }{JK }
\]
\[
	\Rightarrow \frac{MO }{JO } = \input[s7v1]{} 
\]
\[
	\Rightarrow MO = 2\input[s7v2]{} \input[s7v3]{} 
\]"}, {"id": "s8", "n_params": 0, "step_txt": "
hence proved.
\newline

"}]} 

 export const resp = [{"data": ["K", "J", "N"], "text": "$$\text{In triangles JNK and MNL , we have 
$NK = NL$, {given}, 
$\angle KJN = \angle LMN${alternate interior angles}, and $\angle JNK = \angle MNL${as they are vertically opposite angles}.}$$
"}, {"data": [], "text": " "}, {"data": ["J", "K"], "text": "$$\text{Since, corresponding sides of two congruent triangles are equal, therefore, $JK = LM $}$$"}, {"data": ["I", "L", 2], "text": "$$\text{Since, $ IL = JK${as opposite sides of a parallelogram are equal}, therefore, substituting values, we get $IM = 2JK $}$$"}, {"data": ["I", "M", "O"], "text": "$$\text{$\angle IMO = \angle KJO$ {alternate interior angles}, and $\angle IOM = \angle KOJ${vertically opposite angles}}$$ "}, {"data": [], "text": " "}, {"data": [2, "J", "O"], "text": "$$\text{As the ratio of corresponding sides for similar triangles is equal, therefore, $\frac{MO }{JO } = \frac{IM }{JK }$, and on further simplification, we get $MO = 2JO $}$$"}, {"data": [], "text": " "}]
